sentences.en: Ari Hart recently received the accolade of being represented in the Museum of Modern Art.
sentences.cn: 阿里·哈特的作品最近有幸获选在现代艺术馆展出。

sentences.en: Being better than China Mobile is not a great accolade, of course.
sentences.cn: 比中移动强一些, 当然不是多高的赞美.

sentences.en: But to the locals, ridding the city of choking traffic was more important than any accolade.
sentences.cn: 但是对当地人来说, 解决这个城市严重的交通堵塞比任何赞誉都更为重要.

sentences.en: Four restaurants have been awarded the highest accolade of a three - star rating .
sentences.cn: 四家餐馆获授予 三星级 餐馆的最高荣誉称号.

sentences.en: He won accolades as one of America's top test pilots.
sentences.cn: 他作为美国顶级试飞员之一赢得了众多荣誉。

sentences.en: His new book received accolade from the papers.
sentences.cn: 他的新书受到报纸的热烈赞扬.

sentences.en: Strangely, the yen may be the more deserving of that accolade.
sentences.cn: 奇怪的是, 日元或许更配得上这个荣誉称号.

sentences.en: The accolade is designed to recognise all - round excellence.
sentences.cn: 据悉,该称号旨在表扬全面性的卓越成就.

sentences.en: The Nobel prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences.
sentences.cn: 诺贝尔奖已成为科学界的最高荣誉。

sentences.en: The Nobel Prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences.
sentences.cn: 诺贝尔奖已成为科学界的最高荣誉。

words.tran_cn: 荣誉；荣誉称号授予仪式；连谱号；称赞

trans.tran_cn: 嘉奖，表扬，武士爵位的授予（礼），[乐]达谱号
trans.tran_en: praise for someone who is greatly admired, or a prize given to them for their work
